intro: Thlaspi grignense, commonly known as the Grignan cress, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the alpine regions of southern Europe, particularly in France and Italy. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Thlaspi grignense is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
